channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Maximo Anywhere
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Maximo Anywhere

item.title: CVE-2019-4352|2024-09-17T03:34:05.943Z -- ibm -- maximo%20anywhere
item.description: IBM Maximo Anywhere 7.6.4.0 applications could allow obfuscation of the application source code. IBM X-Force ID: 161494.

item.title: CVE-2019-4265|2024-09-17T00:06:45.510Z -- ibm -- maximo%20anywhere
item.description: IBM Maximo Anywhere 7.6.0, 7.6.1, 7.6.2, and 7.6.3 does not have device root detection which could result in an attacker gaining sensitive information about the device. IBM X-Force ID: 160198.

item.title: CVE-2019-4288|2024-09-17T03:14:35.347Z -- ibm -- maximo%20anywhere
item.description: IBM Maximo Anywhere 7.6.2.0, 7.6.2.1, 7.6.3.0, and 7.6.3.1 could disclose highly senstiive user information to an authenticated user with physical access to the device. IBM X-Force ID: 160631.

item.title: CVE-2019-4351|2024-09-17T01:01:19.961Z -- ibm -- maximo%20anywhere
item.description: IBM Maximo Anywhere 7.6.4.0 applications could disclose sensitive information to a user with physical access to the device. IBM X-Force ID: 161493.

item.title: CVE-2019-4349|2024-09-17T02:16:39.775Z -- ibm -- maximo%20anywhere
item.description: IBM Maximo Anywhere 7.6.2.0, 7.6.2.1, 7.6.3.0, and 7.6.3.1 applications can be installed on a deprecated operating system version that could compromised the confidentiality and integrity of the service. IBM X-Force ID: 161486
